titleStmt.title: The Behaviour, last speeches, confessions, and execution of the prisoners that suffered at Tyburn on Fryday the 7th of March, 1678/9 viz. Thomas Coxe and Charles Smith who were drawn thither on a hurdle for treason, Mary Augur, for murther, and Anne Atkins for a burglary ... : with a true account of their carriage and discourses to Mr. Ordinary and others, both in prison and at the place of execution.

notesStmt.note: "At the request of the publisher, I have perused this sheet and do attest the truth of the contents therein. Samuel Smith, Ordinary"
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
